Manage Your Profile Productions on Operabase FAQs Operabase for Agents / Artist Managers Getting Started Manage Your Page FAQs Operabase for Arts Organisations (Companies, Theatres, Opera houses, Festivals & Orchestras) Getting Started Manage Your Page Casting Tool Production Rentals FAQs Operabase for Audiences Performances & Tickets Artists search & discovery Companies / Festivals search & discovery Composers & Works search & discovery kbDom.whenReady(function() { document.querySelectorAll('.kb-category-menu svg').forEach(function(el) { el.addEventListener('click', function(e) { e.preventDefault(); var li = kbDom.closest('li', this); if (li) { li.classList.toggle('open'); } }); }) }) Adding a production FAQs How can I add myself to a production on Operabase? You can add yourself to an existing production on Operabase by logging into your account and navigating to the Performances tab. Click on Add a production and search for the existing production using the filters. Fill in as many details as possible to get an accurate list of results which you can then scroll through. Once you have found the production, select it and proceed to add your name to the Cast & Crew section. Ensure that you select the dates that you will be performing in order for this to display on your repertoire. Click on Submit changes and our team will verify your participation in the production. How do I add a role that isn’t listed? Log in to your account and navigate to the Performances tab. Select the production you wish to edit. Under Cast & Crew: Click on Add a profession if you are part of the crew and the profession isn’t listed. Click on Add a role if you are part of the cast and the role isn’t listed. Make sure that the performance dates are selected to ensure the role reflects on your repertoire. Why isn’t the production I added appearing on my profile? There are a few checks that you can do to ensure that the production you have added appears. Check the following: The production is published and not in drafts The producer of the production has been specified Performance dates have been added Dates that you will perform are indicated If all the above checks have been completed and the production is still not visible on your profile, please email contact@operabase.com as we may need to validate the production. How do I remove a production that I have not performed in from my profile. Log in to your account and navigate to the Performances tab. Select the production you wish to edit and remove your name from the cast / crew list. Once you have done this, click on Submit changes and we will review the change and update after verification of this change. Alternatively, you can email us on contact@operabase.com and specify the name of the production as well as provide a link showing that you are no longer listed. The information on a production is incorrect. How can I fix it? Log in to your account and navigate to the Performances tab. Select the production you wish to edit and make the changes to the production. Once you have done this, click on Submit changes and we will review the changes and update after verification of this change. Alternatively, you can email us on contact@operabase.com and specify the name of the production, indicate the incorrect information and provide a link to where the data is displayed correctly. How can I show that I was a cover / standby for a production? Log in to your account and navigate to the Performances tab. Select the production you wish to edit and click on Cast & Crew. Identify the role / profession in which you were a cover and click the checkbox labelled Add a Cover Role. Add you name in the box and click on Add. Ensure you select the dates that you covered the role / profession so that this role / profession reflects on your repertoire. The role will appear with the words Cover in brackets to distinguish between a cover and non-covered role / profession. How do I add a new composer? When adding a new production to your schedule, in the first step (Production information) you will be required to add musical work details. In that popup, type the composer’s name. If the composer is not on our database, you will need to click on Add new composer. Please fill in as many details as possible to enable our team to verify the information added. (Please note that verification can take some time) How do I add a new musical work? When adding a new production to your schedule, in the first step (Production information) you will be required to add musical work details. In that popup, type in the musical work. If the work is not on our database, you will need to click on Add new musical work. Please fill in as many details as possible including the roles to enable our team to verify the information added. (Please note that verification can take some time) How do I add a new artist who performed but doesn’t appear in the search results? To add an artist to a production, click on the Cast & Crew step and identify the role / profession in which you wish to add a name. Type in the artist’s name and confirm that they are not on the database by looking through the suggested options. If the artist is not on our database, you will need to click on Add new artist. Please add their names and voice type / profession. (Please note that verification can take some time) How do I use show / hide? All new data added will be flagged for review. You will see a notification banner and the sections that need to be reviewed. For each entry (both new and existing), you have the option to show / hide. This gives you complete control over what audience members and casting professionals can view. Please note that production photos and production videos do not have this feature attached. How do I add my name to a production that isn't on Operabase yet? We only list the cast once the information has been published by the company / theatre and is available on their website. You can log in to your profile and add the production to your schedule if you already have confirmation of your participation, however please note that it will not be red masked until the theatre publishes the cast and you submit the proof for red mask verification (please see our FAQ section here regarding what material is required for red mask verification). Alternatively, you can wait until the information is published by the company / theatre and they either update the information on Operabase or our team adds the information to the platform. Why are some productions not visible on my profile? All productions added by companies and festivals on Operabase are listed on your schedule by default and visible to those visiting your profile. If you are a Operabase Artist Premium subscriber you also have the option to add companies and festivals that aren’t listed on Operabase and make these productions visible on your profile. Operabase Artist Premium subscribers will receive a notification that new information has been added to their profile for review. The images and videos that appear on your profile are from productions in which you have participated. Operabase auto-populates this section of your profile with either a video or photo from a production you were in. This is to avoid your profile being blank and is easily remedied. Once you've logged in to your profile, you will need to select an image to be displayed as your profile photo and another photo to be displayed as your cover photo. You have the option to add a video instead of a cover photo to be displayed across the top of your profile page. The video you select, needs to be added under the videos tab as an Intro showreel. How do I delete the video that appears on my profile? Operabase Artist Premium subscribers can log in to their profiles, navigate to the video tab and hide / show, edit and delete any videos that they do not want on their profile. If you do not have an Operabase Artist Premium subscription, we recommend that you start a 30-day free trial to enable you to determine what is visible on your profile and use the various features available. Why can’t I edit / delete some of the videos on my profile? The videos section is divided into Livestream & Full performance videos, Intro showreel, Audition showreel, Video clips & general profile videos and Production videos. If you have a subscription, you will be able to determine which videos are displayed on your profile by navigating to the Videos section in edit. What’s the difference between an Intro showreel and an Audition showreel? The intro showreel is fairly audience-oriented as this is the first thing they'll see when they visit your profile on the media widget. We recommend adding a highlight of a live performance or an engaging video that you'd like to showcase to the 3 million people visiting Operabase. The audition showreel is more for professional users of Operabase. This is where you can demonstrate your range of performances and career goals by adding videos that showcase your abilities. These videos are displayed in our Casting Tool that has 10,000 searches per month as casting professionals from around the world look for artists for their current and future productions. kbDom.whenReady(function() { var smoothScroll = new smoothAnchorsScrolling(); Login to Operabase and click on your image / avatar / initials on the top right Click on the > next to your profile name. This will redirect you to your agency page. With edit access, you can: View page (see the pages as other users view it) Share access Edit agency (contact, office, team) Add artists to the roster Update the representation details of each artist and individual agents handling each artist Request access to artists’ profiles See an overview of the number of pending updates on each artist’s profile Remove artists from the roster Edit agency Click on Edit agency to update your contact details, office information and team members. You can add multiple offices and the team members who work in those offices. To add an office: Click Add another office and add the details The information you add here will be visible to all Operabase users including companies and casting professionals. To add a team member: Click Add another contact and add the details of that particular team members You can add as many team members to an office location as you would like You also have the ability to determine the visibility settings of the team members Add artists to the roster To add artists to your roster: Click on Add artists to the roster Type the artist’s name in the search bar and select their name from the list of suggestions (if the artist is not on the system, you will need to add them. See more details here) If you represent the artist in a profession other than what is marked as their primary profession, click on Add another profession and select the profession / voice type in which you represent the artist. Please note that when you add a new profession to an artist that you represent, this change does not reflect on the artist’s profile. It will only be visible on your roster. Proceed by clicking, Validate. You will be redirected to specify the representation details as well as select the profession that you want displayed alongside the artist’s name on your roster. Please add the artist’s email address / phone number so that they receive an email notifying them of the addition to your roster. Fill in the details to indicate territories in which you represent the artist and if you are their general manager, select the checkbox Select an agency representative from the section below. You will need to have added a team member in order for their names to be searchable in the field. Once complete, click Update and the artist will be listed on your roster. Edit artist on roster The artists on your roster are listed by voice type after which the creative team / crew follow. You can edit the representation details of the artists on your roster and delete them from the roster if you no longer represent the artist. Click on Edit to update representation and the bin icon to remove the artist from your roster. Show additional agencies is particularly useful for casting professionals to determine which agency they would need to contact in order to contract the artist. View updates This gives you a quick overview of the number of pending updates on each artist’s profile. These are triggered by companies / festivals updating and adding productions to their pages. You will have the option to show / hide new information added should you have access to the artist’s profile. Request access This grants 30-days free access to profiles of artists on your roster. You will have access to the Operabase Pro Artist features which enable you to manage all aspects of your artist’s profile during that period. Thereafter, you will need to subscribe on behalf of the artist (we have roster upgrade options available). To use this feature, simply click on “Request access”. An email will be sent to the artist and once they accept, you will receive an email informing you that you can now manage the artist’s profile on their behalf. kbDom.whenReady(function() { var smoothScroll = new smoothAnchorsScrolling(); The new features enables artists to keep their contact details up-to-date and define the representation details. All additions / changes made by artists to the agency section on their profile will trigger a notification that will be sent to the agency. If an artist adds themselves to your agency, you will have the option to accept or decline the addition to your roster. If you accept, the artist will appear on your roster where you can specify the representation details. If an artist edits the representation details, you will have the option to accept or decline the action. If you accept, the representation details will be updated for that artist on your roster. If an artist removes or hides the representation details, you will receive a notification on this action. If it is an error, please email us on contact@operabase.com If an artist shows the representation details, you will receive a notification on this action. Head to https://www.operabase.com/managers/en You can search your agency name under Search managers. How can I get in touch about our page? You can register and subscribe to Operabase Agency Casting Tool PRO. You can claim your agency page by subscribing to Operabase. Please send an email to our Customer Support Team on contact@operabase.com I found our page on Operabase. How do I gain access to it? You will need to register on Operabase to gain access to your page. Who can I share access with? You can share access with anyone in your agency. Please note that whomever you share access with will be able to edit all details on your page. What are the benefits of sharing access? Sharing access to your page allows another individual to ensure your roster and agency details are up-to-date. Login to Operabase and click on your image / avatar / logo on the top right and click on your agency page. On your agency page, click Add artist to the roster. Type the full name of the artist and review the results. If the artist's name does not appear, you will need to add them to Operabase. See more details below. Once you have added the artist, proceed to add representation details and update once you've completed this step. How do I delete an artist to from roster? Login to Operabase and click on your image / avatar / logo on the top right and click on your agency page. On your roster, you will see a list of artists and on the right of each and option to Edit or a bin for deleting. Click on the bin icon and confirm your selection to remove the artist from your roster. Once you have confirmed, the artist will no longer be listed on your agency roster. How do I add a new artist to Operabase? To add a new artist to Operabase, go to your roster and click Add artist to the roster. Search for their name and if it doesn't show up you will see an option to Add new artist. Fill out the details on the following page and validate. Confirm the addition by clicking Create and add to roster. Please note that it will take a few days for our team to validate the new artist added to the database. Why do some artists on our roster have a photo and others do not? One of the benefits of having an Operabase PRO artists subscription is having your photo displayed in various sections on the website. All artists that have a PRO subscription, have the option to add a photo beside their name. You can upgrade the artists on your roster or discuss options for your artists to upgrade themselves. Please email contact@operabase.com for more information kbDom.whenReady(function() { var smoothScroll = new smoothAnchorsScrolling(); var articleSmoothScrolling = function() { function scrollToAnchor(state) { const anchorId = (state && state.anchorId) || null; By subscribing you will join a global platform that collates information from over 100,000 artists and has over 600,000 performances on file. You will join a network favoured by casting professionals who use our industry-leading casting tool that sees 10,000 searches per month. What do I get for subscribing? Unlimited access to our industry leading Casting Tool Archive access Ability to edit / update your agency page Ability to edit / update your roster Artist profile management How much does it cost? We have 2 plans for agencies depending on the features you need access to and your needs. Agency PRO subscription is €850 per annum. More details can be found here. What's the difference between Agency PRO and Agency Roster PRO? Agency PRO gives access to: Casting Tool Archive access Edit / update your agency page (contact details, agents / representatives) Roster management - edit representation details, add / remove artists from the roster Agency Roster PRO gives access to: Edit / update your agency page (contact details, agents / representatives) Roster management - edit representation details, add / remove artists from the roster What happens if I cancel my Agency PRO subscription? If you cancel your subscription, you will no longer be able to access the casting tool and archives. How can I reactivate the subscription? Login in to your account here. Reactivate your subscription by adding a payment method. What payment methods can I use to purchase an Agency PRO subscription? We support several payment methods to pay for your subscription. These include: Credit/ Debit Card PayPal SEPA Direct Debit Google Pay Apple Pay How do I add/remove a new payment method? Login to Operabase and click on your image / avatar / initials on the top right. Click on Account Settings, then click the Payments tab. Under Payments, you can add and remove a payment method. When will the subscription get cancelled? Your subscription will renew automatically at the end of the term (monthly or annual). If you choose to cancel your subscription, it will be cancelled at the end of the billing period. How can I view details on the subscription? Login to Operabase and click on your image / avatar / initials on the top right. Click on Account Settings, then click the Subscriptions tab. Under the Subscriptions tab you will be able to see your current subscription as well as renewal date, start date and the option to cancel. How can I cancel my subscription? Login to Operabase and click on your image / avatar / initials on the top right. Click on Account Settings, then click the Subscriptions tab. Under the Subscriptions tab you will be able to see your current subscription as well as renewal date, start date and the option to cancel. Click on the edit icon to the right of the subscription information Click on Subscription cancellation: Select a reason for cancellation Confirm cancellation How do I switch my payment method to bank transfer? Login to Operabase and click on your image / avatar / initials on the top right. Click on Account Settings, then click the Payments tab and remove the existing payment method. Bank transfers take 7-10 days to get registered in our system. We recommend that you keep a payment method on file to avoid disruption to your subscription. kbDom.whenReady(function() { var smoothScroll = new smoothAnchorsScrolling(); var articleSmoothScrolling = function() { function scrollToAnchor(state) { const anchorId = (state && state.anchorId) || null; If you are a subscriber, login to Operabase and click on your image / avatar / initials on the top right Click on the > next to your profile name. This will redirect you to your company / festival page. Once you’ve landed on your page, you’ll see the following tabs: Seasons Rentals Videos Photos Reviews Company information / festival information Staff & Management Contact & Box office Digital presence Seasons In this section, you can: Add a production Edit a production Show / hide a production - use the slider to select what you’d like to show / hide Review new productions added to your page View and edit productions in the drafts folder Mark productions as cancelled Review new productions added to your organisation’s page You will see a notification with a number on all sections where new information has been added / updated. You can quickly navigate through the sections, and show / hide the new information. For productions, click on Pending action to filter the new information View and edit productions in the drafts folder Any production added to your season but not published, will sit in the drafts folder. This is useful when cast details, dates and other information have not yet been finalised. Click on Drafts to continue editing these productions and once complete, click on Publish so that they can be displayed on your page and be visible to both audience members and appear on artists profiles. Mark productions as cancelled Only use this feature if you want to mark all dates within that production as cancelled. If all the performance dates within a production are cancelled in the Dates section, this will automatically mark the production as cancelled. Please note that this will be visible to audience members. If you cancel a production and would like to reschedule it: Click on Edit on the production and navigate to the Dates & times of performances, livestreams and video-on-demand step Click the 3 vertical dots beside the edit button and click reschedule In the box, insert the new performance dates and time. This will replace the cancelled date with the new date. Search bar To help find a particular production quickly, you can use the search bar. Either click the dropdown arrow as shown in the screenshot to view by season or type in the name of the musical work in the Search by musical work title search and hit search. To find concerts, search by Various, Concert. Rentals This section enables you to list all productions (sets, costumes and score) that you have available for rent as well as whom to contact. You can use the slider to indicate if it is available for rent or not available. Add the contact details of the person that one should contact should they wish to rent. Videos This section is divided into: Livestream & Full performance videos Video clips, trailers & season announcements Production videos You can add, show / hide, edit, delete and reorder videos in this section. For more, click here. All videos added here will be visible on your home page, under the videos tab, on the production link and on the production videos of each artist associated with that production. Livestreams and full performance videos will also be visible on the videos section on Operabase. Photos This section is divided into: Profile photos Production photos You can add, show / hide, edit, delete and reorder photos in this section. All photos added here will be visible on your home page, under the photos tab, on the production link and on the production photos of each artist associated with that production. Reviews You can add, show / hide, edit, delete and reorder reviews in this section. This section is divided into: Company reviews - highlight a particular production that will feature on your company page. Production reviews - all reviews linked to your company productions. These are also displayed on the production page under the reviews tab. To add a review: Click on the Reviews tab and Add review Fill in the details on the review and select if you would like to Add to company review or Add to production To delete a review: Click on the bin icon under the review and delete To edit a review: Click on Edit, make your changes and save. To show / hide a review: Click on the slider to select your preferred option To reorder reviews: Click on Reorder Reviews In the window, drag and drop them in the preferred order and click Save Company information In this section, you can provide the following information: Company name You can add your company name in multiple languages to boost your visibility via our search function (e.g. Wiener Staatsoper - Vienna State Opera, Staatsoper Unter den Linden - Berlin State Opera ). To add your company name in an additional language / languages click on Add another. Company logo Update your company logo in this section. This logo is displayed on your home page and is visible to all users visiting your page. Interior photos Share photos of the interior of the venue. These photos will be displayed on both your page and venue page. Click Add photo and either paste a link or upload a photo. Fill in the details and save. You can edit the photo details or delete the photo at any time. Exterior photos Share photos of the exterior of the venue. These photos will be displayed on both your page and venue page. Click Add photo and either paste a link or upload a photo. Fill in the details and save. You can edit the photo details or delete the photo at any time. Video about your company The video added here will be displayed on your company page. You can only add 1 video to this section. Click Add video and either paste a link or upload the video. Fill in the details and save. You can edit the video details or delete the video at any time. About the company Add a short description of your company that will be displayed on your company page and under the About tab. Click on Add description to insert text into this section. You can add a company description in multiple languages to cater to the global audience members who use Operabase. Click on Edit to make changes, the bin icon to delete and adjust the privacy settings to suit your preference. Venues List all venues associated with your organisation as well as venues that your organisation owns, manages or uses often to perform. These venues will be listed on the venues tab on your page and under Venues on Operabase where users can search for productions by venue. Mark this venue as default This gives you the ability to mark a single venue as the primary venue where productions occur. When adding a production to your season, the venue will be automatically selected unless you specify another venue. Add venue We have many venues listed on Operabase. Please search for existing venues before adding a venue to the platform. In order to search the database for a venue, select the country, city and type the name of the venue to see the results we have that match. To add a venue: Click on Add venue Upload a venue photo and include the details in the window then click Add To edit or delete a venue click on Edit or the bin icon to delete. Associated festivals /company To link festivals associated with your company, click Add festival. You can add multiple festivals to this section and delete them as well. This will be displayed under the media widget on your page and will link to the associated festival’s Operabase page. Please note that the same applies for festivals wanting to associate a company. Young Artist Programs (YAPs) To link associated young artist programs, click on Add young artist program and add the name and URL of the program. You can add multiple YAPs to this section and delete them as well. This will be displayed in the About section on your company page and will redirect users to the official website. Staff & Management Add contact details of staff at your company. You can see their page access, last login date, edit their details and revoke access. To add a member of staff, click Add new contact, fill in the details then click Add You can adjust the visibility to your preference Share access to the page - this will give editing access to this team member. For newly added members, click the 3 vertical dots to: Edit contact details Remove contact For existing members, click the 3 vertical dots to: Edit contact details Revoke access - the team member will no longer have access to edit the page unless you share access again There are 3 different stages of page access indicated: Share access - user does not have access to the page and needs to be invited. Pending - access has been shared but the user has not yet accepted Accepted - user has full access to edit the page Contact & Box office Add your contact information in this section. You can adjust the visibility settings as required. It is divided into: Contact information - address details Company general contact information - general email, phone number (you can add more than 1) Box office details - adding direct box office ticket links for direct checkout on your website (email, phone number and website) The details added here are visible on your company home page and under the Contact tab. Digital presence In this section, you can update / add: Company website Social presence (Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube, etc.) CueTV collection page For all the above, you can determine the visibility of each link added. The links you add to this section will be displayed under your page header section on the home page and under the contact section for audiences to follow / engage with you on social media. kbDom.whenReady(function() { var smoothScroll = new smoothAnchorsScrolling(); Manage Your Profile Productions on Operabase FAQs Operabase for Agents / Artist Managers Getting Started Manage Your Page FAQs Operabase for Arts Organisations (Companies, Theatres, Opera houses, Festivals & Orchestras) Getting Started Manage Your Page Casting Tool Production Rentals FAQs Operabase for Audiences Performances & Tickets Artists search & discovery Companies / Festivals search & discovery Composers & Works search & discovery kbDom.whenReady(function() { document.querySelectorAll('.kb-category-menu svg').forEach(function(el) { el.addEventListener('click', function(e) { e.preventDefault(); var li = kbDom.closest('li', this); if (li) { li.classList.toggle('open'); } }); }) }) Adding a production Login to Operabase and click on your image / avatar / initials on the top right. Click on your company page and you will be redirected to your company landing page. Click on the Edit button to start making changes / updates. Navigate to the Season tab where you will find a list of all production that we have on file for your organisation. You will have 2 options - Add production or Revive production. If you opt to add a production, you will first be prompted to search the existing published productions (this is to help you add a production quicker and / or avoid creating duplicates). However, if it's a revival of a production from a previous season, select the revive option and pick which data to copy over. Add production: Click on Add a production and search for the production in our system. You will get a full list of already published productions that match the filters you’ve selected. Please scroll through the entire list before adding a duplicate / new production. Fill in as many filters as possible to narrow your search. If the production is on Operabase: Select the production from the list. Click the arrow near the date to expand the details on that production. Once you’ve check the details, click Associate your arts organisation with this production. You will be redirected to the edit screen of the published production. Your arts organisation will be automatically added as a co-producer of this production, ie. associated with this production. Ensure you check all the sections of this production, cast & crew, dates, performing venue and photos, video, reviews added earlier to this published production. Once finished, click on the arrow to head back to your schedule and confirm that the production is listed. If the production is not on Operabase: Once you have searched for the production in our system and it does not appear, click on Proceed to add new production. The process has multiple steps and you will need to include as much information as possible in order to be able to publish the production. Add a musical work by clicking on Add musical work details and add the composer and musical work. Indicate how the work is performed by selecting an option from the checkboxes. If the production has a custom title, please include it in the Production custom title field. Select the Producer of the production (Company, Festival or Other). You can search the name in the search bar or create a new entity if it is not listed on our platform. Add a website link for the production in the Tickets & sale dates section. Select the performance date/dates (you can also indicate if there is a live stream date and for past productions, you have the option to add a full performance video). Add the Cast & Crew. This step is very important to make the production visible across all artists' profiles featured in your production. Please check each tab and add more information to the production such as videos, images, ticket links and more Click on Publish once you're done. If you are not ready to publish the production and would like to continue editing it at a later date, please click on drafts to view the production and continue editing. Revive production Many popular works from the repertoire are revived each season. Please use this feature to add a production unless it is a musical work that has never been performed at the company / festival. You can either search within your season or across Operabase. Add details to narrow your search and confirm which production by expanding the search results. Once you have identified the production you'd like to add to your season, select it and choose what information you'd like copied over. Add details to the relevant sections. Once you're done click on Publish. If you are not ready to publish the production and would like to continue editing it at a later date, please click on drafts to view the production and continue editing. Double / triple bill Click on Add new production then Create new production. The process has multiple steps and you will need to include as much information as possible in order to be able to publish the production. Add a musical work by clicking on Add musical work details and add the composer and musical work. Indicate how the work is performed by selecting an option from the checkboxes. Repeat this process to add another musical work. If the production has a custom title, please include it in the Production custom title field. Select the Producer of the production (Company, Festival or Other). You can search the name in the search bar or create a new entity if it is not listed on our platform. Add a website link for the production in the Tickets & sale dates section. Select the performance date/dates (you can also indicate if there is a live stream date and for past productions, you have the option to add a full performance video) Add the Cast & Crew. Please note, if you have added multiple musical works, you will need to specify the cast and crew for each work. This step is very important to make the production visible across all artists' profiles featured in your production. 8. Please check each tab and add more information to the production such as videos, images, ticket links and more 9. Click on "Publish" once you're done Concert / recital / gala: Click on Add new production then Create new production. The process has multiple steps and you will need to include as much information as possible in order to be able to publish the production. Add a musical work by clicking on Add musical work details and add the composer and musical work. If it's a concert featuring multiple composers and works, select Various in the Composer field and Concert in the Musical work field. You can also fill the Excerpts of the work field if you want to add more information. If you know the exact programme details, you can add each composer and musical work. 2. Select Concert / Recital / Orotario to indicate how the work is performed. Repeat this process to add other works that are part of the programme. If the production has a custom title, please include it in the "Production custom title" field 3. Select the Producer of the production (Company, Festival or Other). You can search the name in the search bar or create a new entity if it is not listed on our platform. 4. Add a website link for the production in the Tickets & sale dates section. 5. Select the performance date/dates. 6. Add the Cast & Crew. Please note, if you have added multiple musical works, you will need to specify the cast and crew for each work. This step is very important to make the production visible across all artists' profiles featured in your production. 7. Please check each tab and add more information to the production such as videos, images, ticket links and more. 8. Publish the production. kbDom.whenReady(function() { var smoothScroll = new smoothAnchorsScrolling(); var articleSmoothScrolling = function() { function scrollToAnchor(state) { const anchorId = (state && state.anchorId) || null; Manage Your Profile Productions on Operabase FAQs Operabase for Agents / Artist Managers Getting Started Manage Your Page FAQs Operabase for Arts Organisations (Companies, Theatres, Opera houses, Festivals & Orchestras) Getting Started Manage Your Page Casting Tool Production Rentals FAQs Operabase for Audiences Performances & Tickets Artists search & discovery Companies / Festivals search & discovery Composers & Works search & discovery kbDom.whenReady(function() { document.querySelectorAll('.kb-category-menu svg').forEach(function(el) { el.addEventListener('click', function(e) { e.preventDefault(); var li = kbDom.closest('li', this); if (li) { li.classList.toggle('open'); } }); }) }) Edit Production Overview The edit production section is located under the Seasons tab. This is where you can add a production or edit an existing production / unpublished draft. There are several steps in this process. Production information Add details of the musical work in this section. Production custom title This is mandatory for double / triple bills, adaptations, concerts, recitals, galas, where the title of the production is different from that of the musical work. No need to enter the original musical work title, or its translation in this field. Operabase system automatically translates the original Musical work title based on language used by visitors. Musical work title info Add details pertaining to the musical work that will be performed. The composer name, musical work, excerpt (in case of concerts, recitals, galas programmes) and the manner in which the production is performed are specified in this section. Excerpts are useful for specifying the section performed in a concert or gala (i.e. the act and scene number/title). The information added here is not visible to those who view the production once it has been published. On Operabase, we differentiate between works using the following guidelines: Concert - a mixture of work instrumentation (some symphonic, some vocal) Opera gala - only excerpts / arias from various operas Recital - 1-2 featured performers and an accompanist (pianist) For double / triple bills, add the first musical work then add the others. “How is the musical work performed in your production?” This section is used to define how a work is staged in a production. You can either select from the options provided or type in the Work type and Staging type. The new entries you add will be validated by our team and they can be replaced should we find a duplicate or that the entry is redundant. For example, commonly used work types and staging include: Opera: Staged Semi-staged Opera in Concert Others Concert/Recital/Oratorio Ballet Ballet/Dance with the Orchestra Ballet/Dance without Orchestra Ballet/Dance with Sets Ballet/Dance without Sets Other Musical Musical theatre Zarzuela Oratorio/Orchestral Operetta Vocal/ Song cycle Other Here are some quick tips for production creation: Add at least one musical work Specify what arts organisation has produced this production Add website URL about production and tickets Add all performance dates planned for production run, specify time and venue for each performance date Add everyone involved in production: at least conductor and stage director and main roles, mark on what performance dates they performed Click publish To create a concert performance, where the exact program is not announced or not specified, please select composer Various, musical work Concert. We recommend that you use the Custom title field to enter the concert title. To create a recital performance, where the exact program is not announced or not specified, please select composer Various, musical work Recital. We recommend that you use the Custom title field to enter the concert title. To create an opera gala performance, where the exact program is not announced or not specified, please select composer Various, musical work Opera Gala. We recommend that you use the Custom title field to enter the concert title. Produced by This field indicates the organisation responsible for the artistic creation of the production. It does not refer to financial producers or sponsors of the production (this field is automatically populated with the arts organisation name). If it’s a co-production (where financial or artistic collaboration is involved), click the checkbox and add the name of the company or festival. You can add multiple co-producers. If there are no suggestions that match, please add a new name. Is this a new production that has never been staged before? Selecting this checkbox highlights this production as new and attaches the New production tag which will appear across the platform and in exports to our partners (magazines, newspapers, journalists). Language & surtitles Adding the language that a work is performed as well as surtitles available helps audience members determine whether or not they’ll be able to understand the performance. For casting professionals, this helps them in seeing which languages an artist has experience in performing a musical work. Production poster & trailer This section helps boost engagement with audience members and lets them explore more content on the production in the video section on Operabase. Posters are necessary to announce any associated Livestreams and VOD. Trailers are visible on production pages and will be featured in Production videos of all associated cast members, if they decide to show it. This in turn leads to additional visibility across various parts of Operabase. Production poster You can add a poster that highlights the production or what audiences can expect (e.g. the cast, sets, costumes etc.). Please make sure that the image uploaded follows our photo guidelines. Production video trailer We recommend that you add a short video clip that highlights the production or what audiences can expect (e.g. the cast, sets, costumes etc.). For video examples, see here. Ensemble information This section is divided into: Orchestra Chorus Ballet or dance group Other You have the option to add multiple names in this section. If there are no suggestions that match, please add a new name. Tickets & sale dates You are required to add the production webpage in this section. If the box office link is the same as the production webpage, select the checkbox below. Ticket sale date & time This is very useful for audience members who are looking to purchase tickets for the upcoming season. Please note that you can only add the generic box office link for that production and not for each performance date which will redirect users to the box office where they can select dates, times and seats. Ticket price This helps audience members gauge the price range of tickets. The currencies are listed in abbreviated format. Dates & times of performances, livestreams and video-on-demand Add Physical performance dates, Livestream dates, Full performance video or VOD in this section. Physical performance dates Select the month and year on the calendar and click each day of the performance. If there are several performances in one day you can add them later. We recommend adding performance times and the correct location of a performance. Select Country, then city, then available venue from the listing. If you can’t find a venue listed, check if you have selected the correct city in the correct country. Otherwise, create a new venue. Adding the correct country and city combination for live performances is crucial to correctly feature productions on Operabase performance listings as well as venue and maps listing. Specifying correct venues allows validated productions to be featured on the Operabase production listings which is incredibly popular with opera lovers and visitors of Operabase: Livestream dates Select the month and year on the calendar and click each day of performance. If there are several streams in one day you can add them later. Full performance video or VOD Used when the production is available on demand. Click Add full performance video and fill out as much information as possible. Productions can have livestream and physical dates but you will need to specify the cast for every date you select. To delete a date: Click on the date on the calendar, or click the three vertical dots next to the date below and select Delete performance To add time and venue: Click on edit on the dates you have selected (there are different tabs to switch between physical, livestream, and VOD) Add the time (in 24hr format) Choose type of performance - world premiere, national premiere, tour Choose a venue - type in the fields and select from the options. If the venue is not listed in the options given, you will need to add the venue to the system and provide as much information as possible so we can verify it. Hosted by - only use when another company will host a performance / performances Apply this same info for other selected dates - useful to copy the exact same information across all dates or several dates. Adding another performance time to the same date: If there are multiple performance times on a day, add a time then click Add time You will need to fill in the details (as listed above) again as the will not carry over Use the Mark as sold out slider to indicate if a performance is sold out To mark a date for an existing production as cancelled: Click on the date on the calendar, or click the three vertical dots next to the date below and select Mark as cancelled Please note that the dates cannot be marked as cancelled unless the production has been published. The Mark as cancelled option will not appear when the production is in drafts Livestream dates: fill out as much info as possible if applicable. Livestream cannot be featured on the Video section without a primary poster, weblink to where streaming can be seen, time and time zone of livestream. Full performance video: fill out as much info as possible if applicable Cast & Crew List cast and crew members in this section. If they are not listed on Operabase, you will need to add them to the system using the Add new artist button. For more details click here. If a role or profession doesn’t appear on the list, you will need to add it to the production (e.g. add custom roles for any assistant directors/conductors) If there are multiple works in the production, make sure to click Apply to other musical works if relevant. If not, then you will need to switch between tabs and add the cast and crew. Add to all performance dates - automatically adds that particular individual to all the dates that production is on. Please note that when you add a new artist, this box is automatically selected. If you are adding multiple artists to one role, only the first one will have this applied to them therefore uncheck the box when adding multiple artists to one role. Make sure to select all dates for the ensembles added in the Ensemble information section NOTE: Please ensure that you select each date that each artist will perform. If this is not done, the production won't appear in their schedule and it will not be included in the artist’s repertoire. Production videos Add videos to enrich your content for audience members looking for productions to attend. The section is divided into Production trailers and Production videos. You can either paste a video link or upload a video. Once done, please add as much information as possible including video credits. Please see more details in our video guidelines article. Production photos Add photos to enrich your content for audience members looking for productions to attend. The section is divided into Production posters and Production photos. You can either paste a link or upload a photo Once done, please add as much information as possible including photographer credits. Please see more details in our photo guidelines article. Reviews Add a general review of the production. You will need to paste the link and fill in as much information as possible. Production synopsis Production description - an overview of the production. Copy paste the text and select the language You can add descriptions in multiple languages but repeating the process Click Edit to make changes or the bin icon to delete Production synopsis - general synopsis and details on each act and scene. Copy paste the text and select the language You can add the synopsis in multiple languages but repeating the process Click Edit to make changes or the bin icon to delete Production booklet If you have the programme of the performance in digital format you can either paste the link or upload the programme in different languages. If the production is a co-production and each producer has their own programme prepared, please add as many production booklets as you would like. Quick navigation You can jump to a section that you wish to edit using the Navigate option. For existing productions (companies / festivals), you will see both Navigate and Actions. The Actions button allows you to: Hide a production - useful for published productions that you no longer want visible to audience members. This action will also hide it from the profiles of participating cast and crew. Mark as cancelled - cancel all dates of the production. Please note that the Publish button is disabled for already published productions. kbDom.whenReady(function() { var smoothScroll = new smoothAnchorsScrolling(); var articleSmoothScrolling = function() { function scrollToAnchor(state) { const anchorId = (state && state.anchorId) || null; Not only do the videos you add appear on your company / festival page but also on artist profiles if they have participated in the production. The video section is divided as follows: Livestream & Full performance videos Under the Livestream & Full performance videos section, you can: Show / Hide videos Videos in this section are attached to a production in your season. Not only will they display on your company page but also on artist profiles who were part of the cast and crew, thus maximising visibility. The videos are also listed in the Videos tab on Operabase and are accessible to audience members. Above image shows how videos are searchable and displayed on Operabase. To add videos to this section, you will need to: Log in to your Operabase account and go to your page Click Edit and select the Schedule tab Add your live stream or full performance video link directly to the production in your season Video clips, trailers & season announcements Under the Video clips, trailers & season announcements section, you can: Show / Hide videos Add videos Edit videos Delete videos Reorder videos - use the drag and drop feature to move videos around and arrange them in the preferred order To add videos to this section, you will need to: Log in to your Operabase account and go to your page Click Edit and select the Schedule tab Add your video link directly to the production on your schedule or, Add the video directly to this section: Click Add video Insert a link or upload a video then click Add Fill in the details and select which section you’d like the video to appear. If you select Add to company video, the video will be displayed as a general video clip. If you select Add to a production you can search the musical work that you want to attach the video to and it will be displayed under production videos and on the profiles of all artists who participated in that production. The Operabase Casting Tool is the leading tool in the industry for future season planning, last-minute replacements and jump-ins. There are over 10,000 searches per month for talent discovery and programming. Can anyone use the casting tool? Access to the Casting Tool is via a paid subscription. You can see our pricing plans here. What are the benefits of using the Casting Tool? The Operabase casting tool is built on the world's largest and most reliable database of operatic and other performing arts activity. Developed over 23 years, the Operabase casting tool provides a reliable, constantly updated, multilingual, simple and efficient system for casting professionals across the world. Featuring verified performance information of casts and crew with direct links to profiles for either a quick or a more detailed review of information on repertoire, performances, career and voice type, videos and photos of performances and showreels, reviews, contact and representation information. The results can be sorted and filtered as desired, simplifying the process of putting together a cast or finding a last-minute replacement. Artist managers / Agencies are featured on the casting tool alongside the artists that they represent. kbDom.whenReady(function() { var smoothScroll = new smoothAnchorsScrolling(); var articleSmoothScrolling = function() { function scrollToAnchor(state) { const anchorId = (state && state.anchorId) || null; With improved search filters and columned results, casting professionals can save time & easily narrow down their search. Accessing the Casting Tool: After logging in, click on "Casting Tool" to be redirected to the Casting Tool, where you can initiate your search. Initiating a Search: Enter the details of the works you're looking for - composer, musical work, date, and country. Click "Go" to initiate the search. Columned Search Results: The search results are now presented in columns, making it easier to read and comprehend the details of the cast, crew, and other roles associated with the production. Expanding Results View: You can expand the view to see more details on an artist. This will show the production dates, Operabase verified red mask icon, the organisation that produced the production, orchestra and chorus information (if available), director and conductor, and the cast involved. Additionally, you will see the artist's specific performance dates, venue/stage, and information indicating the dates the artist performed in that particular production. Utilising Filters: The casting tool offers various filters to further narrow down your search: Language: You can filter artists based on their language proficiency, ensuring they are suitable for performances in specific languages. This filter helps you find artists who are well-versed in the required language for a particular production. Conductor & Director: Narrow your search by selecting the conductor or director who led the production. Cast Performed With: Find artists based on the artists they have performed with in the past. Company, Festival, Venue & Locations: Use these filters to refine your search based on the companies, festivals, venues, or locations where the artists have performed. Using these filters allows you to identify those who have performed at specific companies / festivals and in specific venues. This helps in selecting artists with relevant experience for a particular production or performance setting. Adding Another Role: After performing your initial search and selecting a cast member, crew, or other role, you can further filter your search by adding another role. Click on "Add another role," and a pop-up will appear, allowing you to specify the relationship between the roles (performed both roles, either role, or not done role). After making your selection, click "Next," and enter the details of the next musical work. Continue to select cast, crew, or other roles and click "Go" to view the list of artists based on your specified criteria. Sorting Results: You can also sort your results by the artist’s last name or by the performance date by using the sorting options on the right above your search results. Operabase's enhanced casting tool provides casting professionals with efficient and effective search filters, columned results, and the option to add multiple roles for more targeted searches. By utilising these features, casting directors can find the perfect talent for their productions quickly and easily. kbDom.whenReady(function() { var smoothScroll = new smoothAnchorsScrolling(); var articleSmoothScrolling = function() { function scrollToAnchor(state) { const anchorId = (state && state.anchorId) || null; Companies, theatres and festivals can list their productions (sets, costumes and scores) for rent. This is viewed by the largest professional audience in the world looking for production rentals or co-productions. Contact information for rentals are listed by the companies, theatres and festivals. You can directly contact the companies, theatres and festivals if you wish to rent any production in part or whole. How do I use this feature? Any production that has been listed in a company, theatre, or festival season information can be made “available” for rent in a single click. To make a production visible for rent: Log in to your Operabase PRO account and navigate to your organisation Edit page: Rentals tab. Select the production you wish to make available and use the toggle button to change the setting to “Available for rent” Select if sets, costumes and/or scores are available for rent with production as well Please add the contact the selected/specified person directly by using the “Show Contact Details” option This will appear in the “Rentals” section on Operabase for companies to view and contact you directly. kbDom.whenReady(function() { var smoothScroll = new smoothAnchorsScrolling(); The new features include share options, a prominent ticket button and restructured content, making it easier for users to explore productions in-depth. Visual Enhancements and Share Options: Upon opening a production page, you will find images and videos related to the production at the top. Additionally, a share button has been introduced, allowing you to share the production with others via copy link, email, WhatsApp, LinkedIn, Facebook, or Twitter. Ticket Purchase Made Easier: The tickets button is now more prominent and visible. By clicking on it, you will be redirected to the box office ticketing website, where you can conveniently purchase tickets for the production. Accessing the organisation’s Operabase page and official website: On the production page, you can easily visit the organisation's Operabase page and their official website for further details. Performance Details: The production page provides a clear listing of the range of dates on which the production is scheduled. Information on the performance language and any available subtitles is displayed, making it convenient to identify language options. Verification Indication: The presence of a red mask indicates that the information on this production has been verified by Operabase, ensuring reliability and accuracy. Restructured Cast and Crew Listing: The cast and crew are now listed under a dedicated "Credits" section. This section includes the producer, conductor, and stage director details, followed by the cast and crew (set designers, costume designers, etc.). Performers' specific dates are also mentioned under each performer. About Section and Further Reading: An "About" section is now available on the production page, providing details about the production. Clicking "See all" redirects you to a page with a production synopsis (if available) and links for further reading on the composer, musical work, and the organisation producing the work. Videos and Photos: Videos are displayed after the About section. Click "See more" to access additional videos. The photos section functions similarly, where clicking "See more" reveals more photos. Performance Dates and Venues: Operabase has reintroduced its calendar feature, offering toggling between calendar view and venue view. The calendar view plots the production dates on the calendar, and below, you can view specific details for each date, including venues and performance times. The venue view provides in-depth information about each production date's venue, and clicking on the map redirects you to the venue page on Operabase. The total number of production dates is also indicated, and clicking "See all" provides an expanded view of all dates. kbDom.whenReady(function() { var smoothScroll = new smoothAnchorsScrolling(); var articleSmoothScrolling = function() { function scrollToAnchor(state) { const anchorId = (state && state.anchorId) || null; From large houses to niche festivals, Operabase is the world's largest and most reliable source of information for what’s on, where it’s on, and how you can watch it. Season information is regularly updated to reflect upcoming events and past performances as well as live streams, Video on Demand, trailers, behind-the-scenes, photos, reviews, programme booklets and more. (Note: if you are an Company, theatre or festival, and want to update and manage your organisation's profile on Operabase, please click here ) To search / view company page: Click on the “Companies” tab You can either search by country by click on the country of choice or search the company by name in the “Search company” bar If you choose to search by country: You will find a complete list of companies in that country and you can then filter you search further by typing in the company name in the search bar. Companies are listed in alphabetical order by city. Click on the drop down arrow to view all scheduled productions from that company For more details on that production, click “View performance details” which will redirect you to the production page where you can book tickets (if available), view trailers / videos, photos, reviews and learn more about the cast and crew as well as venue details. If you choose to search directly in the “Search company” bar: You will be given a list of suggestions corresponding to what you have typed. Click on your preferred option to be redirected to the company page where you can view the company’s entire season, videos of associated productions, photos, reviews, social media and more. To search / view festival page: Click on the “Festivals” tab You can search by year, search by country by click on the country of choice or search the festival by name in the “Search festivals” bar If you choose to search by country: You will find a complete list of festivals in that country and you can then filter you search further by typing in the festival name in the search bar. Festivals are listed in alphabetical order by city. Click on the drop down arrow to view all scheduled productions from that festival For more details on that production, click “View performance details” which will redirect you to the production page where you can book tickets (if available), view trailers / videos, photos, reviews and learn more about the cast and crew as well as venue details. If you choose to search directly in the “Search festival” bar: You will be given a list of suggestions corresponding to what you have typed. Click on your preferred option to be redirected to the festival page where you can view the festival’s entire season, videos of associated productions, photos, reviews, social media and more. If you choose to search by year: You will see a list of countries with productions for that particular year. You can use either option a or b detailed above. kbDom.whenReady(function() { var smoothScroll = new smoothAnchorsScrolling(); var articleSmoothScrolling = function() { function scrollToAnchor(state) { const anchorId = (state && state.anchorId) || null; You can view composers by name or use the search bar to find a composer by name. Composer search & discovery On the menu, hover over "More" then click “Composers” Search by name or go through the list of composers. To view more on the composer, either click on their name or on “View details” Once on the composer’s page, you’ll be able to view a complete list of their works To view more on a particular work, click on the “>” arrow on the work of choice, where you will be redirected to view: All performances (click on the dropdown arrow to view cast & crew, dates and venue) including ticket links where relevant Upcoming performances (next 30 days) including ticket links where relevant Work search & discovery In this section, you will find information about musical works. You can view a list of works or use the search bar to narrow your search. On the menu, hover over "More" then click “Musical Works” Fill in the “Musical work”, “Composer” and “Type” parameters to narrow your search results. You do not have to fill in all fields, you can simply start typing to see a list of suggestions. Click “Go” to search / narrow your results You can click on the musical work name, composer or view details. Clicking on composer will take you to the composer page where you can view other works and search upcoming productions Clicking on musical work or view details, will take you to the musical work page where you can view all performances (click on the dropdown arrow to view cast & crew, dates and venue) including ticket links where relevant or Upcoming performances (next 30 days) including ticket links where relevant kbDom.whenReady(function() { var smoothScroll = new smoothAnchorsScrolling();
